text: Hey FoodTubers! Donal here, last year I was in Vietnam and I am absolutely obsessed with all the brilliant

street food on offer there so I'm gonna
make up my favorite one a 'Pho Ga' which is

basically a Vietnamese poached chicken
soup
to kick-start this flavour sensation in this little bowl I have very aromatic corriander seeds, some star anise,

and a little bit of clove- so get it
in there into a dry frying pan and turn
on the heat

we've got some ginger and we got some
onion but there's an interesting

technique with this, keep the skin on your
ginger but just split it down in half

like that and with your onion you're gonna do
exactly the same you can take the skin

off this, while our seeds are toasting up
get the heat on your other hob and

using and using our metal tongs we're going
to grab that slice of ginger and put it

straight over that wonderful flame, doing
this over the open flame is going to

result in the most wonderful smoky smell
and flavor that's gonna infuse this
brilliant chicken noodle soup

it's exactly the same method with the
onion and now I've got my onions, my ginger
I can turn off my heat here, I've got all these brilliant little spices which are

bursting with flavor so get all that
wonderful flavor straight into a big big

pot and all those great ingredients go
straight in here and then in on top of that

you want to grab a whole chicken,
skin-on get it straight into the pot

and just plonk it in there, and then fill it
up with some cold water it's now gonna

cook with a lid for about 50 minutes
after it's cooked and the chicken is nicely
cooked through

leave it to cool in the liquid and once
you've done that you should get left
with a really rich broth and beautifully cooked chicken and that's exactly

what I have, so I have a chicken which is cooked up
I've taken it out of it's liquid

and I have the most beautiful rich broth, in
here I've taken the chicken out and I've
continued to reduce down that liquid and by reducing it down you get left with a really intense flavor in the soup
get that stock right on a high heat and you want it to come to a rolling boil while you prepare the rest
of your ingredients, and now that you have cooked up this brilliant chicken, it's time to shred it up

there is so much meat off this chicken
and that's why I love this, it uses the whole bird you get

the wings, you get the legs, you get all
the breast meat so the first thing to do
is take off the skin, once you have the skin off it's time to shred up the meat

chicken is all sorted now we've got our
pot boiling so it's time to cook off our

rice noodles what you want to look for
is these brilliant rice noodles that
cook in an instant

so worth while getting them if you go to any
Asian store you would find these

they're very very accessible and in most
supermarkets have them there as well
take off a handful like this and we're gonna make one portion of soup so get that straight in that boiling

liquid with a large handful of chicken
pieces and just one or two little chillies for a bit of heat
now you might have noticed that I haven't added any seasoning here so to season it up I'm

just gonna add a drop of fish sauce in
here, that rice noodle is gonna cook out just until
it's nice and tender and then it's ready to serve

turn off the heat and just swirl all
those noodles together with the tongs

and then just push them into a bowl, look at that
 steamy broth get it straight into the bowl and then

using a little slotted spoon like this just grab
up any of those wonderful chicken pieces
that are in there as well and push them over the top, to finish it off you have got to get lots
of that wonderful broth, the magic of this soup is the broth so make sure you're generous with it
over the top and now you have the bones of a brilliant little pho but to finish it off
get some mint leaves in there, get a little bit of coriander, get some thai basil if you have it

and then just push them in on the side like this
top up with some spring onion just on

the side like that, for a tiny touch of heat and some
wonderful colour in there get some chillies in there and

now, the best part, it's time to taste it so using
chopsticks because this is the way they
eat it in Vietnam give it a quick slurp and give it a nice little taste of that beautiful poached chicken if this is not

the best chicken noodle soup in the
